text:
3. The people Act. Documentary type of program produced by NBC in
conjunction with the 20th Century fund. Originally aired by NBC.
Concerned with the democratic solving of common problems at the grass
roots level. Excellently done programs. Narrated by Ben Qrauer.
U* Stories N Stuff. A children’s entertainment program offering stories,
songs, and horseplay. (That’s the wstuff**.)
5. tJ of I Festival Concerts. Thirteen programs of concerts and lectures and/
at or panels which were part of the U of Illinois1 program during the recent
Festival of Contemporary arte* Primarily concerned with contemporary
music. Includes an all Hindemith program conducted by the composer. Maybe
a talk: by him also if we can find another copy. (Someone erased the Music
School’s copy.)
6. Campus Visitor. A series of interviews with I. Keith Tyler as the
interviewer. All the interviewees are foreigners or persons recently-
returned from foreign lands. The them© is international understanding. A
simple program, but an effective one.
?. Masterworks Story. A series of fifteen minute programs dealing with the
musical masterpieces. Conducted by Paul Hanson of WCAL* Talks about the
composer and details about the composition of a particular great work.
Plays either the whole work or excerpts if it is long. A very neat fifteen
minute classical music show.
8. The Seven Utopias. A series done in Australia and dealing with the seven
major concepts of Utopia that have been of concern to philosophers for
many ages. Starts with Plato, I believe* DonAt know much about it. MC
says it is worth while and it is supposed to get here from them very soon.
This breaks down as followsi
3 hour-long programs.
3 half hour programs.
2 quarter hour programs.
Music- 2% hours.
Drama- 1 hour*
Documentary- J hour
Talk- 3/k hour
Children- % § hour.
